title: For Sale:  Sig Sauer 1911 Carry Scorpion 45 ACP FDE N/S G10
postcontent:
This is a brand new in box Sig Sauer 1911 Carry Scorpion chambered for .45 ACP. The legendary 1911 design has been brought into the 21st century with the refinement today’s shooters demand. The Sig Sauer 1911 proves that close tolerances equal complete reliability and need not be incompatible in an off-the-shelf pistol. Sig Sauer has introduced clean, distinct lines that American shooters have embraced, while retaining the crisp trigger pull, classic ergonomics, and exceptional accuracy they expect.

The 1911 pistols from Sig Sauer feature all stainless steel frames and slides machined to exacting tolerances and hand-fitted to ensure reliability and performance. Like all Sig Sauer products the 1911 contains only premium internal parts including a 4.2" match grade barrel, hammer/sear set and trigger. The de-horned slides and frames are machined to exacting tolerances and hand-fitted to insure reliability and performance.

The 1911 Carry Scorpion features a practical Flat Dark Earth finish on the frame and slide, complimented by double diamond Hogue G-10 grips and a matching mainspring housing cover. The frame features a Picatinny rail ideal for mounting tactical lights or laser sights, and has a checkered front strap. The slide has SigLite low profile night sights mounted for accurate shot placement in low light and even darkness. An upturned beavertail grip safety and ambidextrous thumb safety enhanced handling confidence. The skeletonized hammer and flat gooved trigger lend a high end custom look.

Caliber: .45 ACP

Capacity: Two 8 round magazines included

Barrel: 4.2"

Dimensions: 7.7" long, 5.5" tall, 1.4" wide

Weight: 35.4 ounces

title: Want To Buy:  WTB Browning Hi Power 9mm T series or C Series
postcontent:
Looking to barter and trade to obtain a nice Belgium made Browning Hi Power 9mm T series 1960's to 1970's with the red backed grips.

This is the info I got from a browning expert. In summary, I  dont want to go past 1983...................

For a NICE "T" series, expect to pay around the $1000 range. These pistols were built between 1964 and 1970ish.

For a NICE "C" series (directly after the "T" series, you could probably find a nice example for the $800 range. Built from 1969 to 1975.

For a NICE post "C" series, still MADE AND ASSEMBLED in Belgium (recommended), I've seen them go for as little as $750 with a few slipping through for even less. These start with a 245 on the serial number and have an alpha code after the 245 that will tell you the year. So if you find a Made in Belgium HP with a S/N that starts 245PX, it was built in 1983.

Z=1
Y=2
X=3
W=4
V=5
T=6
R=7
P=8
N=9
M=0

title: For Sale/Trade:  HK 416D 22LR (NEW)
location: South Mills NC, Hampton Roads, Virginia
postcontent:
The .22 caliber HK 416 is loaded with authentic features. From its appearance, feel, and operation, right down to the sling swivel incorporated into the stock, the 416 D145RS is a replica in every sense.

Like all the .22LR H&Ks offered by Umarex, the 416 is a dedicated .22 rimfire rifle. It is engineered and built in Germany by Carl Walther with a match grade precision barrel, upper and lower metal receivers, a retractable stock, and a machined rail interface system. The 416’s pistol grip and buttstock are authentic in that they include storage compartments for small tools or batteries.

The magazines for the .22 caliber 416 are made of high-strength polymer and are designed to make loading simple and efficient. They’re available in either a 20- or 10-

Operation

The .22 caliber HK 416 D145RS operates on a blowback system. The dust cover functions and the bolt holds open when the magazine empties. Its sights are on-rail and the rear sight is adjustable for windage and elevation. Its safety selector rotates 90 degrees from ‘On Safe’ to ‘Fire’. Take down for basic cleaning is simple—there are no loose parts. Just remove the rear receiver pin and pivot the upper receiver to open.

title: For Sale:  Dillon 550B Reloading System -- Mint, many extras
postcontent:
I bought this entire system to be my home reloading center for 9mm, .40 S&W and .44 Magnum.  I have the entire core 550B system, selling for $350, but I also have three complete quick-change kits, powder systems and die sets for fast-changeover convenience that I can add as options to this sale.

The press is mint.  I'm moving for work to a place at which I can't shoot, so I'm selling my stuff.  I've used the press literally once to load 100 rounds of .44 Magnum.  The entire system is brand-new condition.  Yes, it hurts to sell it and also to not be able to shoot soon!

I'll sell the press system and one complete calilber setup (powder system, primer tubes, changeover kit and dies) for $400.

I'll add a whole additional caliber changeover kit, powder system, dies and tubes for $150 more (a $240 value, if you can find them).  Each powder system has two powder-measure bars for convenient readiness to throw different weights of powder.

I'll sell everything I have -- that's three complete caliber systems -- for $600 and throw in 1) over half-full Blue Dot and Red Dot powder containers, 2) 100 bullets of your choice (.44 JHP Speer or .40 S&W TC Winchester) and 3) 100 new brass of your choice (.44 or .40).  The system includes priming automation (electric sensor).

Again, though, central press system with one caliber (no dies):  $350.  
With one die set:  $400

No trades, please.  If you have other package ideas, give me a write and we'll haggle something out.

Also have the following:

200 .44 Magnum Winchester brass (unopened, new): add $30
200 .44 Magnum Speer 200 gr. JHP bullets (product 4425): add $50 (great deal, scarce)
300 .40 S&W Winchester 165 gr. truncated-core bullets: add $50 (scarce)

title: For Sale/Trade:  Custom Archangel Mosin - completely upgraded
postcontent:
I have a fully customized Archangel Mosin Nagant, the only thing stock/original is the receiver which is in excellent condition and is very smooth. Picked this up recently from another member and now have a "need" for some other guns.

A gunsmith performed all the work on it, including barrel install, turned-down bolt, scope mount tapping and installation.

Mosin 
New barrel to replace the surplus stock barrel 
Archangel stock (fully adjustable length of pull)
Turned down bolt
Rock Solid Ltd Scope mount 
Also have 40 rds of factory Winchester soft points (deer/bore rounds) and some surplus stuff somewhere as well.

If you are not familiar with the 7.62x54r round, its bigger than a 308 and more devastating, and you can get surplus rounds for 22 cents a round for surplus stuff (so 5 rounds for every one round of average/cheap 308).

If you put this whole thing together using the best prices you can possibly find on-line, you would spend around $700. I would like $550 cash or I LOVE trades.


What I am looking for:
AK47
AK74
Railed handgun - prefer 9mm and forst choice would be a CZ P07 Duty. Also like the Taurus 92A1, Beretta 92A1/M9A1, etc.

title: For Sale/Trade:  LWRC M6-SL Gas Piston w/ Eotech
postcontent:
This rifle has only see about 100 rounds or so.  The rifle is in great shape, pretty much perfect, and come with everything you see in the pics including the original charging handle, the Eotech 552.A65, and a magpul sling but plate.  LWRC is one of the industry leaders and this rifle shows why.  If interested text me 7 five 7 nine 9 five 4 nine 5 seven.

The new M6-SL is a replacement of the LWRC base model M6 rifle of old. The SL, which stands for 'stretch-lightweight', incoroprates everything a shooter needs in a quality light-weight base model rifle. With the M6-SL, LWRCI has brought to the market the lightest factory piston driven rifle to date.

The SL comes standard with Magpul furniture. A MOE mid-length handguard, MOE Stock, and MOE pistol grip provide excellent handling characteristics, while minimizing added weight. The SL utilizes the 'stretch' or mid-length piston system, providing a more direct recoil impulse for faster follow-up shots.

The most distinct feature of the SL is the barrel. The barrel still utilizes LWRCI's NiCorr surface conversion technology on a cold-hammer-forged barrel, but the barrel is of a smaller diameter to reduce weight.

The SL comes standard with the EXO (nickel-boron) plated one piece bolt carrier and the EXO coated enhanced fire control group. The SL also comes standard with a Daniel Defense A1.5 fixed rear sight and a fixed A2 front sight post.

The SL is a great addition to the LWRCI family of rifles. It provides users with an extremely lightweight rifle that incorporates our patented short-stroke piston operating system, has all of the advanced coatings that make our rifles the best in the world, and does so at an entry level price.

SIG556® ER features a 16” military grade cold hammer forged barrel, chambered in 5.56mm NATO, with a twist rate of 1 in 7”. The flash suppressor uses a standard .5 x 28 TPI thread pattern, ensuring compatibility with after-market accessories. The forearm housing the gas operating system is a vented non-slip polymer featuring the SIG TriRail design with three integrated Picatinny rails for mounting accessories. The optional flip up front combat sight is adjustable for windage and elevation. The Picatinny rail equipped receiver is made of high strength steel with a durable wear-resistant Nitron® finish. The Picatinny rail features an optional flip up rear sight that works in concert with the optional front combat sight, providing iron sight performance and a back up sight option for optics. The trigger housing is machined from an aircraft grade aluminum alloy forging with a hard-coat anodized finish designed to survive extreme conditions. The rifle comes equipped with a smooth two-stage trigger, ambidextrous safety and is designed to accept standard AR magazines. A 30-round magazine is supplied with each rifle. The collapsible buttstock features a rubber butt pad, multiple sling attachment points, and a waterproof battery compartment. The ergonomically designed pistol grip features an integrated storage compartment. Select versions feature a folding stock with the ability to collapse, providing the best of both worlds
